intro: Thymus serpyllum var. praecox, commonly known as early thyme, is a low-growing perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It produces small, fragrant flowers that range in color from pink to white, typically blooming in early spring. The plant has aromatic, narrow leaves that are often used in culinary and medicinal applications. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its compact growth habit and ornamental value make it a popular choice for landscaping.
